name: Nri.Stylers
comment:
Helper module for working with fonts

@docs makeFont

values.name: makeFont
values.comment: takes a size and a color and creates a font

name: Nri.Colors

values.name: highlightLightBlue
values.comment:
cyan with alpha of 0.75

rgba(66, 219, 255, 0.75)

values.name: highlightLightMagenta
values.comment:
magenta with alpha of 0.5

rgba(255, 0 ,189, 0.5)

values.name: highlightLightYellow
values.comment:
yellow with alpha of 0.75

rgba(254, 199 ,9, 0.75)

name: Nri.Accessibility

values.name: invisibleText
values.comment:
invisibleText is most frequently useful on labels.

For instance, if there's an input element with a placeholder,
someone on a screenreader would miss the content of that placeholder.

With invisibleText, we can avoid redundancy across visible label
and placeholder, but maintain semantic meaning of the input for other users.

name: Nri.Fonts
comment:
Fonts for NoRedInk projects

@docs baseFont, quizFont

values.name: baseFont
values.comment: Font for instructions, headers, and pretty much everything else

values.name: quizFont
values.comment: Font for question sentences, or most interactable or graded fields

name: Nri.Colors.Extra

values.name: toCoreColor
values.comment:
Convert a Css.Color into a Color.Color

    toCoreColor (Css.hex "#FFFFFF") -- "RGBA 255 255 255 1 : Color.Color"

values.name: withAlpha
values.comment:
Add an alpha property to a Css.Color

    grassland -- "{ value = "#56bf74", color = Compatible, red = 86, green = 191, blue = 116, alpha = 1, warnings = [] } : Css.Color"
    withAlpha 0.5 grassland -- "{ value = "rgba(86, 191, 116, 0.5)", color = Compatible, warnings = [], red = 86, green = 191, blue = 116, alpha = 0.5 } : Css.Color"

name: Nri.Css.Extra
comment:
Put helper functions, styles, and anything else that might be missing from elm-css. If it gets used enough and the use case is in the scope of elm-css, we can open PRs/Issues to discuss or add the features to that package.

@docs lineHeightNum

values.name: lineHeightNum
values.comment: Use a Css.Num value for line height

name: Nri
comment:
A collection of helpers for working with NoRedInk projects
@docs name
